### destagger_array { #scahpy.core.coords.destagger_array }

```python
core.coords.destagger_array(da, axis, pad=False)
```

Removes staggering along a given dimension by averaging adjacent values.
Optionally (CROCO) expands the coordinate by one step on each side before averaging.

#### Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type         | Description                                                                                                       | Default    |
|--------|--------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| da     | xr.DataArray | Staggered variable to be destaggered.                                                                             | _required_ |
| axis   | str          | Name of the staggered dimension (e.g., 'xi_u', 'eta_v', 's_w').                                                   | _required_ |
| pad    | bool         | If True, expands the coordinate by one inferred step on each edge and fills new points with NaN (default: False). | `False`    |

#### Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type         | Description                                                                                           |
|--------|--------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|        | xr.DataArray | Destaggered array with the specified dimension reduced by one and coordinate reassigned to midpoints. |
